Posts.Content: Go to the doctor and both of you get it checked out, now. It may be nothing but you have to go. It's that simple lizard50
Posts.Title: Lump under nipple?

Posts.Content: Go to the right doctor and get it all checked out. No point worrying untill you know for sure. Lizard50
Posts.Title: swollen glands, swollen armpit, breast discharge

Posts.Content: god, I hate the waiting deal. The one thing that really helped me with my breast cancer was getting the wonderful book on breast cancer. Susan Love Breast Book. Everything you ever want to know about every type of breast cancer is in this book. Get educated. Take charge on how you want treatment. It gave me a great sense of power when I felt powerless. I just had 1/2 of my colon removed and I am doing well. Remember there are a lot of gifts to be found when we have to walk through fear. You are not alone. Good luck, lizard50
Posts.Title: Scared, waiting for results

Posts.Content: You seeing a doctor is the right move. Generally cancer does not hurt. Try not to worry, and let us know how it goes. Seeing your doctor on Tuesday is fine. Lizard50
Posts.Title: new lump, scared, suggestions please...

Posts.Content: Please get a second opinion, and make sure that you have the best in the field. Also I recommend getting SUSAN LOVE'S BREAST BOOK. Take charge of your treatment and get educated. That made all the differance for me. good luck
Posts.Title: Scared, waiting for results

Posts.Content: stop it right now. You have more important things to worry about. It has nothing to do with cancer. if it continues to bug you get a boop job.
Posts.Title: abnormal breast size(1 bigger than the other) a problem?

Posts.Content: Why didn't you get it checked out? Do get a mamogram. That way you can put your minds at ease.Lizard50
Posts.Title: Are "Lumpy" breast normal?

Posts.Content: Don't worry, they are just being careful. I have had many needle biopseys(sp) done and it is no big deal. It is great that you have doctors who are making sure. You will be fine. When it is that small you have nothing to worry about. lizard50
Posts.Title: I have a fibroadenoma does it need to be removed?

Posts.Content: You must go to see the doctor yourself and get the facts.It sounds to wierd. Good luck Lizard50
Posts.Title: Breast cancer in 89 year old woman.

Posts.Content: I would go to a oncologist. They will be more abjective and will read the reports and then direct you. I would also highly recommend Susan Love's " Breast Book" It is excellent and easy to read and will give you so much great information. Best of luck Lizard
Posts.Title: need 2nd opinion for biopsy

Posts.Content: I highly recommend the book "The breast book" by Susan Love. It will answer all you questions. Also I have tons of lumps, I always get them checked. Go see your doctor.Lizard50
Posts.Title: Back again...found another lump

Posts.Content: Get it checked out all of you. If you are concerned go to a doctor and then you can all rest easy. Lizard50
Posts.Title: small hard bump on areola

Posts.Content: I have been on tamoxifen for over a year and I have been very lucky. I have not gained any weight and my periods have stopped and I am having some hot flashes. I have had friends who have had a really bad time with it, this is not in your head. I have to tell you that with a area of cancer that big I would try to find something. There is a new drug out there that I read about and I am sorry that I can not remember the name of it. It is suppose to have much less side effects. My feeling is that if the quality of your life is messed-up you need to try something eles. If your doctor says that it is in your head, ask him to try it for awhile. Also pick up the great book " the breast book" by Susan Love. it is great and easy to read and you will get so much great inforrmation. Lizard50
Posts.Title: ARIMIDEX
